function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Less urgent tasks such as research projects and long-term monitoring are deprioritized during the pandemic, leading to gaps in data and understanding of conservation needs.","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Loss of income from tourism impacting biodiversity and increasing reliance on natural resources","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased hunting pressure and shifts in trading patterns leading to enhanced trading of endangered species","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sudden and sustained decline in tourist numbers impacting local revenue and livelihoods","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on livelihoods and food security leading to increased exploitation of wildlife and habitats","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Loss of funds for conservation areas due to temporary cessation of international tourism","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact on community engagement events and fundraising for conservation projects","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Declines in travel and tourism revenue affecting conservation funding","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in conservation funding and government commitments due to economic downturn","category":"Global recession and economic instability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Declines in conservation revenue and capacity, livelihood and trade disruptions","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-stationarity of the series, as indicated by the kpss test.","category":"Financial strains and liquidity crises","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of long-run linkages between macroeconomic variables and bank profile components.","category":"Global recession and economic instability","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High npl/l ratios in asean countries","category":"Financial strains and liquidity crises","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliability of econometric equations","category":"Financial strains and liquidity crises","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Calculation of soundness based on financial variables","category":"Financial strains and liquidity crises","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Preliminary tests for kmo and bartlett tests","category":"Financial strains and liquidity crises","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Direct impact of banks’ financial performance on their soundness","category":"Financial strains and liquidity crises","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of statistical techniques for categorizing banks based on creditworthiness","category":"Financial strains and liquidity crises","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate credit guarantee ratio in a recession","category":"Global recession and economic instability","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex loan demand equations may lead to incorrect loan assessments and allocations.","category":"Financial strains and liquidity crises","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate equilibrium loan amount calculations may result in under or over-financing of small and medium enterprises smes .","category":"Financial strains and liquidity crises","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Non-optimal credit guarantee ratio determination may increase the risk of loan default and financial losses.","category":"Global recession and economic instability","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Moral hazard resulting from adopting the same credit guarantee ratio for all banks","category":"Global recession and economic instability","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete modeling of the credit guarantee ratio may lead to suboptimal policy decisions","category":"Global recession and economic instability","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High cost of borrowing for smes in developing nations","category":"Lower investment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Credit constraints affecting smes’ employment and operations","category":"Lower employment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Structural challenges in the long run","category":"Resource and capability risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rise in cash flow risk for smes","category":"Financial strains and liquidity crises","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of academic study on the impact of covid-19 on asean economies","category":"Global recession and economic instability","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on smes in asean countries","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unpreparedness of smes to face disruptions caused by covid-19","category":"Discontinuity of services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Classical format of research funding is slow and may not generate evidence and knowledge fast enough in dynamic situations like a pandemic.","category":"Discontinuity of services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Competitive nature of funding calls overlooks certain eu regions, leading to limited participation from those areas.","category":"Discontinuity of services","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in floor area standards for parking bays","category":"Construction industry impacts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sensitivity to parameters with semi-arbitrary values","category":"Resource and capability risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlation analyses used to evaluate association between quantitative variables","category":"Construction industry impacts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"No statistically significant difference in impact score between rounds in group a","category":"Discontinuity of services","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Differences in the perceived impact of covid-19 on the construction industry between group a and group b may reflect variations in experiences and perspectives related to the pandemic.","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreased working time for group b participants in the initial survey round","category":"Discontinuity of services","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Utilizing a small sample size of 97 subjects may lead to a lack of generalizability of the findings.","category":"Discontinuity of services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Construction professionals may have varied perceptions of the covid-19 impact on construction, leading to a lack of consensus in response planning.","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disruption of construction projects due to epidemics","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of pandemic on mobility","category":"Pandemic impact on markets","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exploitative rental practices by landlords","category":"Supply chain disruptions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decline in public investment in decommodified housing","category":"Lower investment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Energy requirements and potential for counterbalancing savings in water systems digitalization","category":"Resource and capability risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inefficient collection of invoices and economic resources for water utility","category":"Supply chain disruptions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreased revenue from water service leading to potential costly breakdowns and permanent closure of businesses or industries","category":"Supply chain disruptions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Internationalisation of power supply may introduce compatibility issues and safety risks.","category":"Global recession and economic instability","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of inexpensive but accurate and readily available devices for high performance building applications","category":"Construction industry impacts","confidence":"High"}]}
